org.odk.collect.android.audio

Class AudioHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.odk.collect.android.audio.AudioHelper
  • Deprecated. 
    wrapping the ViewModel like this doesn't really fit with other ways we've integrated widgets with "external" services. Instead of this widgets should talk to AudioPlayer and the Activity/Fragment components should talk to the ViewModel itself.

    @Deprecated
public class AudioHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Object for setting up playback of audio clips with AudioButton and controls. Only one clip can be played at once so when a clip is played from a view or from the `play` method any currently playing audio will stop.

    Clips are identified using a `clipID` which enables the playback state of clips to survive configuration changes etc. Two views should not use the same `clipID` unless they are intended to have the same playback state i.e. when one is played the other also appears to be playing. This allows for different controls to play the same file but not appear to all be playing at once.

    An AudioHelper instance is designed to live at an Activity level. However, the underlying implementation uses a ViewModel so it is safe to construct multiple instances (within a View or Fragment for instance) if needed within one Activity.
